data.text: Then Bildad the Shuhite answered, and said,
How long wilt thou speak these things,
Will the Lord be unjust when he judges;
If thy sons have sinned before him,
But be thou early in prayer to the Lord Almighty.
If thou art pure and true, he will hearken to thy supplication,
Though then thy beginning should be small,
For ask of the former generation,
(For we are of yesterday, and know nothing;
Shall not these teach thee, and report to thee,
Does the rush flourish without water,
When it is yet on the root, and though it has not been cut down,
Thus then shall be the end of all that forget the Lord:
For his house shall be without inhabitants,
If he should prop up his house, it shall not stand:
For it is moist under the sun,
He lies down upon a gathering of stones,
If God should destroy him, his place shall deny him.
That such is the overthrow of the ungodly?
For the Lord will by no means reject the harmless man;
But he will fill with laughter the mouth of the sincere,
But their adversaries shall clothe themselves with shame;
